business.headline: Curious case of Pearl Kapur: The self-proclaimed billionaire behind Zyber 365On his Instagram profile, Pearl Kapur brands himself as "India's youngest billionaire," a title he embraces while carefully sidestepping questions about the legitimacy of his company's meteoric rise.

Fuel price cut unlikely as Middle East tensions drive crude oil surge: ReportThe conflict in the Middle East has pushed oil prices higher, with Brent crude oil prices increasing significantly, affecting global supply.
US adds more jobs in September; unemployment falls to 4.1%Average hourly earnings grew by 0.4% in September, slightly lower than the 0.5% increase seen in August.

Sensex crashes over 4,000 points this week, investors lose Rs 16 lakh crore The combined market capitalisation of companies listed on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) has shrunk to Rs 461.26 lakh crore, marking a loss of Rs 15.9 lakh crore.

Temasek eyes a bite of Haldiram's at valuation of $11 billion: ReportThe discussions with Temasek come at a time when Haldiram's is exploring its growth potential and could pave the way for an initial public offering (IPO).

Hyundai seeks $19 billion valuation for its mega India IPO, says reportHyundai is expected to file updated documents with India's market regulator, the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi), possibly as soon as Monday.

Sensex, Nifty tank as Middle East tensions, oil price worries spook marketsThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 808.65 points to close at 81,688.45, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 200.25 points to end at 25,049.85.
Explained: Why are gold prices on the riseGold futures, maturing on December 5, 2024, were priced at Rs 76,468 per 10 grams after gaining Rs 224, or 0.29%, from the previous close of Rs 76,244.

India's services sector growth hits 10-month low in SeptemberThe HSBC final India Services purchasing managers' index, compiled by S&P Global, fell to 57.7 in September from a five-month high of 60.9 in August and was below a preliminary estimate of 58.9.

India's per capita income to surge by $2,000 in 5 years, says Nirmala SitharamanFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman highlighted that India is well on track to double its per capita income within a few years, largely driven by economic and structural reforms implemented over the past decade.
Sensex surges 800 points as IT, bank stocks power market reboundHigh-weightage Nifty IT led the sectoral indices, rising 1.8%, fuelled by strong performances in Infosys and Tech Mahindra.

Tata Motors shares rise 2% today. Will the auto stock's rally continue?Over the past year, Tata Motors has gained 54.05%, and over three years, it has surged by over 170%. The stock's beta over the past year is roughly 1, indicating average volatility during that period.

Apple deepens India foothold with new stores, local production of all iPhonesApple is planning to expand its retail presence in India with more flagship Apple stores in key cities as it aims to create more direct customer interactions and experiences.

Diffusion Engineers shares list at 12% premium: Hold or book profit? Diffusion Engineers listing: The shares listed at Rs 188 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), marking an 11.90% rise over the issue price of Rs 168.

Gold, silver price today, October 4, 2024: Precious metals record hike on MCXGold Price Today October 4, 2024: Both gold and silver are trading on the higher side of the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Friday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.
Explained: Why Reliance Power shares hit 5% lower circuit todayDespite Friday's drop, Reliance Power shares have surged 64% in a month, gaining 112.82% year-to-date and 171.70% annually.

HDFC Bank shares Q2 update, says deposit growth outpaces loansHDFC Bank Q2 update: The bank's gross advances, or loans sanctioned and disbursed, rose by 1.3% to Rs 25.19 lakh crore in the quarter ending September, following a slight 0.8% decline in the previous quarter.
Ratan Tata sells 5% stake in Upstox. The gains will surprise you Despite this partial sale, Ratan Tata still holds 95% of his original stake in the company.

Diffusion Engineers shares list at 12% premium, misses expectationsDiffusion Engineers shares listing: The shares of Diffusion Engineers Limited opened at Rs 188 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) marking a premium of 11.90% over its issue price of Rs 168.

Mark Zuckerberg overtakes Jeff Bezos as world's second-richest person The dramatic rise in Mark Zuckerberg's fortune has been fuelled by a 23% increase in Meta's stock price since its better-than-expected Q2 results.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Advantage INDIA in close J&K contest: India Today-CVoter exit poll Live UpdatesJammu and Kashmir Exit Poll Result 2024: Mehbooba Mufti's PDP and independents fielded by Engineer Rashid are likely to play the role of a kingmaker, with exit polls predicting a hung Assembly.

J&K Exit Poll Live: INDIA bloc ahead, Mehbooba Mufti's PDP 'crashes'Haryana, J&K Election Exit Poll Results Live Updates: As the Assembly elections have concluded in both Jammu and Kashmir and Haryana, all eyes are on the exit polls to predict the political landscape. The three-phase elections for the 90 seats in Jammu & Kashmir concluded on October 1, while final phase polling in Haryana wrapped up at 6 pm today.

Hassan Nasrallah's heir 'unreachable' after Israeli strikes in Lebanon: ReportUncertainty looms over Hezbollah as Hashem Safieddine, the successor to Hassan Nasrallah, remains reportedly unreachable after an Israeli airstrike targeted Beirut.

Anti-women party: BJP shares video of Haryana Congress worker 'molested' at eventThe BJP called Congress the most 'anti-women party' even as Congress MP Kumari Selja condemned the incident and demanded strict action against the accused.

Ground report: Israel's Haifa turns into virtual ghost town amid Hezbollah strikesIndia Today's Gaurav Sawant reached Haifa, a once bustling city in northern Israel that now wears a deserted look as Hezbollah continues to strike Israel.

Civil person, will behave myself: S Jaishankar's quip on Pak visit for SCO meetExternal Affairs Minister S Jaishankar announced that his upcoming visit to Pakistan for the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) summit later this month will focus on the multilateral event rather than India-Pakistan relations.

Omar Abdullah scoffs at exit polls: Only October 8 numbers matter, rest timepassOmar Abdullah emphasised that he is tuning out the chatter on channels, social media, and WhatsApp, saying, "The only numbers that matter will be revealed on the 8th of October. The rest is just time pass."

High drama during bus marshals' protest, AAP MLA falls at BJP leader's feetThe AAP shared videos showing party leader Saurabh Bharadwaj falling on the feet of BJP leader Vijender Gupta, urging him to accompany AAP workers to the Lt Governor's office to submit a Cabinet note on the reinstatement of bus marshals.

Horror of red hands, wails of empty strollers: Symbolism amid warThe death and devastation in the war in the Middle East have given rise to symbols, and new meanings to old ones. Be it empty strollers, red-painted hands, Palestinian keys or blood-stained trousers. Here's a look at them on the eve of the first anniversary of the October 7 attack and the Israel-Iran war.

J&K gets five MLAs even before the first vote is counted; Opposition furiousFor the first time in J&K, five nominated members will play a significant role in government formation. The Congress has strongly opposed the move to nominate members and accused the BJP of attempting to manipulate election results.

Uses money to win elections: PM jabs Congress over Delhi drug bustPrime Minister Narendra Modi criticised the Congress over a Rs 5,000-crore drug bust in Delhi, accusing the party of pushing youth toward drugs to fund elections.

Ground Report: Israeli family, hiding due to Hezbollah threat, speaks to India TodayReporting from ground zero in Israel, India Today TV spoke to family who took shelter due to a fresh wave of attack from Hezbollah. The family hid in a specially-constructed room, which is equipped with reinforced metal doors, windows and walls that cannot be penetrated by splinters.

Telugu actor Rajendra Prasad's daughter dies of cardiac arrestVeteran Telugu actor Rajendra Prasad's daughter died of cardiac arrest on October 5. Actors Nani, Jr NTR and others paid heartfelt tributes on social media.

Huge protests after Bengal girl's body found in canal, family alleges rapeThe girl's family alleged that they were harassed by the police when they went to file a complaint. A video showed a group of people marching towards a police station in protest.

Ground report: Hezbollah hideout in Beirut reduced to rubble in Israeli strikeOver 25 Hezbollah fighters died in Israeli airstrikes in Dahiyeh district in the southern part of Beirut on Friday evening. India Today TV's Ashraf Wani, showed visuals of a building which was completely destroyed in the Israeli attacks.

Bureaucrat's son who tried to mow down girlfriend claims she texted him to meetAshwajit Gaikwad, a Maharashtra bureaucrat's son, who is accused of running over her influencer-girlfriend with his vehicle in December last year, claimed that she had texted her for a meeting with him, but she also wanted aggravation of charges against him.

Complaint filed against actor Nagarjuna Akkineni over land encroachmentNagarjuna Akkineni's N Convention Centre was demolished in August as part of a drive to remove illegal constructions that have encroached on water bodies and public lands.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Israel targets north Lebanon, kills Hamas leader in fresh airstrikes  Live UpdatesIsraeli airstrikes targeting Hezbollah intensified in Lebanon, with blasts reported in Beirut and near the airport, as the offensive also expanded to northern Lebanon.

Khamenei: Student protester to cleric ready for war with Israel at 85Iran's Ayatollah Ali Khamenei was born to a cleric who lived in a house with one room and eight children. A student who joined the protests against the Shah of Iran in 1979, Khamenei rose to become the supreme leader. A rifle in his Friday sermon, signalled that the 85-year-old Khamenei was ready to lead a direct war against Israel.

Is wearing open footwear good in an Indian climate?Open footwear can help prevent excessive perspiration and reduce the risk of sweat-induced infections, but wearing them constantly may expose your feet to dirt, pollution, and harmful sun rays.

Gave up arms, I'm a Gandhian now: Separatist Yasin Malik to tribunalSeparatist leader Yasin Malik told a UAPA tribunal that he's given up armed struggle and adopted a "Gandhian way of resistance" to promote a "united, independent Kashmir".

Congress MP's son hospitalised after arrest in road rage caseGanesh Handore, son of senior Congress leader Chandrakant Handore, was hospitalised at Mumbai's JJ Hospital due to a spike in blood sugar levels following his arrest in a road rage case.

Woman's body found in UK flat 3 years after her diary entry read 'I'm starving'Laura Winham, who was reportedly deaf and schizophrenic, believed that maintaining contact with her family would harm her. She stopped social media contact with her family in 2014.

Lokesh Kanagaraj on rumours of Rajinikanth's health affected by Coolie shootFilmmaker Lokesh Kanagaraj addressed rumours about Rajinikanth's health being affected by the filming of Coolie. He clarified that the actor had informed him about his upcoming treatment a month earlier.

Actor Angelina Jolie to auction her vintage 1958 Ferrari 250 GTAngelina Jolie's rare 1958 Ferrari 250 GT, a black coupe with Pininfarina coachwork, will be auctioned in Paris. The car is expected to fetch between €600,000 and €800,000.

Director Lokesh Kanagaraj on Vijay's political entry: Wish to see him in filmsTamil superstar Thalapathy Vijay has announced his entry into politics, forming his party Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam. Director Lokesh Kanagaraj shared his thoughts on Vijay's decision and wishes him success.

Matka teaser: Varun Tej is an invincible gangster in Karuna Kumar's action-thrillerThe teaser of Varun Tej's Matka was released today, October 5. In the action-thriller the actor is seen in a never-seen-before avatar.

sports.headline: Stay calm, no such pressure: Fatima Sana's mantra for India clashWomen's T20 World Cup 2024: Pakistan skipper Fatima Sana said that Pakistan will look to stay calm when they lock horns with Harmanpreet Kaur's India on Sunday in Dubai.

Mumbai team to be felicitated after first Irani Cup win in 27 yearsThe Mumbai Cricket Association will felicitate the Ajinkya Rahane-led side in a ceremony after it clinched its first Irani Cup in 27 years.

Women's T20 World Cup, IND vs PAK: Head-to-Head and past recordsIndia's women's team seeks redemption against Pakistan after a crushing 58-run loss to New Zealand in their T20 World Cup opener. Harmanpreet Kaur's side aims to bounce back in this high-pressure rivalry clash on October 6.

Aavishkar Salvi backs India to bounce back against PakistanWomen's T20 World Cup 2024: Aavishkar Salvi said that India have the potential to stage a strong comeback against Pakistan after losing to New Zealand on Friday.

Stay calm and united: How India plan to bounce back after World Cup opener lossWomen's T20 World Cup 2024: India's assistant coach Aavishkar Salvi said he is confident that the team will be calm and composed when they face arch-rivals Pakistan in Dubai on Sunday, October 6. India lost to New Zealand in their opening match on Friday.

Pakistan board to downsize list of centrally contracted cricketersThe Pakistan Cricket Board plans to reduce the number of centrally contracted players for the 2024/25 season. This move follows recommendations from foreign coaches and aims to reward players committed to top fitness levels.

Defending champions Australia ease past Sri Lanka on tough Sharjah pitch Women's T20 World Cup 2024: Alyssa Healy's Australia started their campaign on a stupendous note after beating Sri Lanka by six wickets at the Sharjah Cricket Stadium.

Gary Kirsten returns to SA as Pakistan to announce next white-ball captain laterGary Kirsten, Pakistan's head coach for limited-overs, heads back to South Africa as PCB gears up to announce a new white-ball captain. Mohammad Rizwan and Shaheen Shah Afridi are the leading contenders.

Babar Azam stepping down as captain won't affect Test team: Saud ShakeelPAK vs ENG: Saud Shakeel said that Pakistan dressing room has a healthy environment and won't be affected after Babar Azam stepped down as the ODI and T20I skipper.

Joe Root 'excited' about new England bowling attack for Pakistan TestJoe Root expressed excitement about England's revamped bowling attack featuring fresh talents like Brydon Carse and Gus Atkinson, offering a balanced pace-spin combination for their first Test against Pakistan in Multan.

1st T20I: Towhid Hridoy expects a 'slow pitch' at Gwalior stadium Bangladesh middle-order batter Towhid Hridoy has predicted a slow pitch for the opening T20I against India at the Shrimant Madhavrao Scindia Stadium. This will mark the venue's first international match, presenting both teams with an unfamiliar challenge.

Defending champions Australia ease past Sri Lanka on tough Sharjah pitch Women's T20 World Cup 2024: Alyssa Healy's Australia started their campaign on a stupendous note after beating Sri Lanka by six wickets at the Sharjah Cricket Stadium.

Gary Kirsten returns to SA as Pakistan to announce next white-ball captain laterGary Kirsten, Pakistan's head coach for limited-overs, heads back to South Africa as PCB gears up to announce a new white-ball captain. Mohammad Rizwan and Shaheen Shah Afridi are the leading contenders.

Babar Azam stepping down as captain won't affect Test team: Saud ShakeelPAK vs ENG: Saud Shakeel said that Pakistan dressing room has a healthy environment and won't be affected after Babar Azam stepped down as the ODI and T20I skipper.

Joe Root 'excited' about new England bowling attack for Pakistan TestJoe Root expressed excitement about England's revamped bowling attack featuring fresh talents like Brydon Carse and Gus Atkinson, offering a balanced pace-spin combination for their first Test against Pakistan in Multan.

1st T20I: Towhid Hridoy expects a 'slow pitch' at Gwalior stadium Bangladesh middle-order batter Towhid Hridoy has predicted a slow pitch for the opening T20I against India at the Shrimant Madhavrao Scindia Stadium. This will mark the venue's first international match, presenting both teams with an unfamiliar challenge.

Chasing Sachin Tendulkar's record? Joe Root says milestones don't motivate himPakistan vs England, Multan Test: Speaking to the press ahead of the first Test in Multan, Joe Root said milestones don't drive him any more and he is focussed on enjoying his time with the England cricket team. Root is just 70 runs behind England's all-time Test scorer, Alastair Cook.

Irani Cup for Mumbai, my double hundred for brother Musheer: Sarfaraz KhanAfter Mumbai won the Iran Cup, Sarfaraz Khan dedicated his match-winning double-century in the Irani Cup to his brother Musheer, who missed the tournament due to an accident.

R Ashwin empathises with Pakistan cricketers, highlights their dilemma amid chaosIndia spinner Ravichandran Ashwin has empathised with Pakistan players amidst a cricketing crisis in their country. Ashwin has highlighted the dilemma of the players amidst constant change in leadership positions.

Asian Youth Archery: Vaishnavi Pawar stars as Indian women win silverRising star Vaishnavi Pawar helped India secure silver in the recurve U-18 women's team category at the 2024 Asian Youth Archery Championship, defeating South Korea in the semifinals and narrowly missing gold against Chinese Taipei.

Bangladesh cricket team doesn't visit Gwalior mosque, holds Friday prayer at hotelIndia vs Bangladesh: Security has been stepped up in Gwalior amid a call for a 'Gwalior bandh' on match day by right-wing outfits in protest against alleged atrocities on Hindus in Bangladesh.

T20 World Cup: India women's team faces online trolling after loss vs New ZealandThe Indian women's team was heavily trolled after their T20 World Cup opener loss to New Zealand. The heavy bullying came after Harmanpreet Kaur lost their bearings and were bowled out for just 102 runs in Dubai.

Ben Stokes ruled out of first Test in Pakistan, return delayedBen Stokes has been ruled out of England's first Test against Pakistan as he continues to recover from a hamstring injury he picked up earlier this year. Ollie Pope will be stepping in as captain yet again for the Multan clash starting October 7, after a similar fate in the Sri Lanka series.

Mumbai win Irani Cup for first time in 27 years after Tanush Kotian rescue actIrani Cup 2024: Mumbai held Rest of India to a draw after securing a first-innings lead in Lucknow. Ajinkya Rahane's men went on to win the domestic trophy for the 15th time, first triumph since the 1997-98 season.

Bangladesh cricket team doesn't visit Gwalior mosque, holds Friday prayer at hotelIndia vs Bangladesh: Security has been stepped up in Gwalior amid a call for a 'Gwalior bandh' on match day by right-wing outfits in protest against alleged atrocities on Hindus in Bangladesh.

T20 World Cup: India women's team faces online trolling after loss vs New ZealandThe Indian women's team was heavily trolled after their T20 World Cup opener loss to New Zealand. The heavy bullying came after Harmanpreet Kaur lost their bearings and were bowled out for just 102 runs in Dubai.

Ben Stokes ruled out of first Test in Pakistan, return delayedBen Stokes has been ruled out of England's first Test against Pakistan as he continues to recover from a hamstring injury he picked up earlier this year. Ollie Pope will be stepping in as captain yet again for the Multan clash starting October 7, after a similar fate in the Sri Lanka series.

Mumbai win Irani Cup for first time in 27 years after Tanush Kotian rescue actIrani Cup 2024: Mumbai held Rest of India to a draw after securing a first-innings lead in Lucknow. Ajinkya Rahane's men went on to win the domestic trophy for the 15th time, first triumph since the 1997-98 season.

Manchester United's Jim Ratcliffe snubs Ten Hag axing talks: Not my callManchester United co-owner Jim Ratcliffe dodged questions about Erik ten Hag's future amid the club's ongoing struggles, fueling speculation about the Dutch manager's job security following United's poor start to the season across all competitions.

West Indies tour of Sri Lanka: Pooran, Russell and Hetmyer opt out of T20I seriesWest Indies tour of Australia: West Indies will be without some of their senior players, including Andre Russell and Shimron Hetmyer. The tourists will play three T20Is and as many ODIs in the island nation from October 13 to 26.

IND vs BAN, 1st T20I Live streaming: All you need to knowIndia's youthful T20I squad, led by Suryakumar Yadav, prepares to maintain their winning momentum against Bangladesh in a three-match series starting October 6, with fresh talents and experienced players aiming for continued dominance in Gwalior.

Italian legend Paolo Maldini's son Daniel earns maiden call upItaly coach Luciano Spalletti has named AC Milan defender Matteo Gabbia and Monza forward Daniel Maldini in a 23-man squad for their upcoming Nations League fixtures.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
